record.field: > The show is done and all the financial and logistical questions are resolved.

> The negociation is on hold. >> No actions are needed for the next months.
TIP : It is a useful Stage for a negociation which is lost for a festival's current edition but is still opened for next year's.
> No email send yet. >> The customer need to be contacted.

> 1st email sent to public contact. >> The Curator's contact need to be confirmed.
TIP : It is a good practice to stay in stage '1st contact' if you only filled an online form for instance.

> The Curator's contact is confirmed by a third party. >> But he didn't answer yet.
TIP : The Curator's confirmed contact is an identified way to get in touch with the "human" that will make the real decision to select your project.
At this stage, you only "think" this contact is the Curator's. It is a good practice to change the Curator's "Odoo Contact" form status to "Checked" only when you receive a real answer from this contact.

> The Curator confirmed he/she received your presentation. >> But he didn't gave any feedback yet.
TIP : This stage corresponds to the famous "I will return you back if I am interested", but sent by a real person. It is a good practice to avoid moving to "Received by Curator" if the received answer is obviously sent by an automatic mail.
If the answer is trustworthy, the Curator's "Odoo Contact" form status should be changed to "Checked".

> The Curator made a first positive artistic feedback >> But he didn't tell you what would be his budget
TIP : The famous "Are you free on this date ?". The Curator could have asked for your financial conditions but it is a good practice to stay on "Interest" until you know if his/her budget is suitable with yours.

> The Curator asked to reserve the date and didn't make a negative feedback about money. >> The deal is not closed, but it looks great !
TIP : It is a (very) good practice to stay on stage "Option" until both the financial AND schedule terms are defined by the Curator.
> The Curator confirmed his/her proposition with both show date and fee defined. >> You still need to answer positively to win the deal.

> The deal is closed ! >> You still have to perform AND receive the payment.
TIP : It is a good practice to avoid moving to "Done" before the payment is received... even if the event already occured.
